availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas H. Moore (Provost Marshall KY 7th/Clark County Whisky merchant)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, merchant and provost marshall. Kentucky native. Married to Mariah E. Bright Moore in Lincoln, Tennessee, on March 17, 1842. Father of Anna E. Moore, James M. Moore, Mary A. Moore, Pattie Moore, Kate Moore, and Thomas F. Moore. Merchant in Clark County in 1860. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in 1860. Provost marshall of the Seventh Judicial District of Kentucky in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 75.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 32-33.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 20.
Tennessee Marriage Records, Nashville, Tennessee, Lincoln County Marriages.
Find A Grave, "Thomas H. Moore (July 22, 1821-March 19, 1879)," Memorial #100545403, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100545403 (accessed March 14, 2017).
KYR-0001-004-1361.
